# R Program 

`R` is now one of the top languages used in `Data Science`, `Analytics`, and `Research`. For a `newbie` who is new to `R Programming language` this blog will help them to understand how to use this tool for their day to day activities.

## RGUI

To open RGUI click start button and go-to letter R and click on `R folder` and select the latest version of R [In this session will select version `4.3.1`]

![](1.PNG){width=20%}

- Opens a new `RGui`session window, where users could start writing `code`in **R Console**

![](2.png){width=40%}

::: callout-note
Tool tab contains:

- File   
- Edit  
- View
- Misc
- Packages
- Windows
- Help
- Add-on toolbar
:::

#### Open Script

- Open Script ![](10.PNG){width=5%} is used to open the a workspace just select and start developing your code

#### Load Workspace

- Opens a new tab when selected this functionality ![](11.PNG){width=5%}, need to select any pre-loaded or saved workspace to start working on previous projects 

#### Save workspace

- Select to save the current work space using this functionality ![](12.PNG){width=5%} 

#### Copy

- User need to select and select the button to ![](13.PNG){width=5%} copy the code

#### Paste

- Once user select and copy the code need to select this button ![](14.PNG){width=5%} to paste the code in the session

#### Copy and paste

- User ![](15.PNG){width=5%} could able to select the code and press button to copy and paste the code


#### Stop current computation

- This ![](16.PNG){width=5%} button helps to stop current running session

#### Print

- Print ![](17.PNG){width=5%} button helps to print the session window
